name: trout, production in semi-intensive system, in lake | trout | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18259/documentation

This activity presents data from the Anchoveta Supply Chain project. Trout production in Andean lakes. Technologically speaking, these systems are simple and well established. Cage systems are anchored relatively close to shore, and are tended by means of small motor boats. This system uses predominantly commercial aquafeed, including floating pellets.   

The system boundaries for the inventory includes the partial life cycle of production means, from construction, through maintenance and the use phase

System ends at the gate of the farm, excluding the transport of the output trout to wholesaling
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/032:Aquaculture/0322:Freshwater aquaculture

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Aquaculture system common in Lake Titicaca and other Andean water bodies
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Simple clusters of metal floating cages, commercial floating feed
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Trout production in the Titicaca lake (Peru, Bolivia) was asumed to represent lake-based trout production worldwide
